title: Packet Losses Fix??
body:
Okay, in a nutshell, my network is dropping packets
I know it because my ping is fine but I can't move or just float around, or cannot cast spells.
I already wrote a thread on this but I don't know where it went or why it just did not post.
After a route check to the server, apparently my signal goes up to New Jersey to go somewhere towards pacific
I think this is because of my ISP throttle, since when they throttle me they just block files (I think)
But the game would be working fine for like 20-30 min and would suddenly drop packets.
I don't get that it just happens like that.
Is there any way for me to fix this?
More direct connection?
Thanks,

replies.body: If this is indeed happening due to network restrictions or rerouting by your ISP, then you may want to reach out to them about it. Have you already tried contacting your ISP's technical support about this issue?

It looks like your issues may start just outside your network. Running a full traceroute with [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) will help us get a better understanding of what's going on and could prove useful when reaching out to your ISP. After loading up the app, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Please let me know if you have any issues with these steps.
I have the exact same issue. and I have not fixed it yet
